clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Risk Markers in Veterans With Post Traumatic Stress Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Risk Markers in Veterans With PTSD

lead_sponsor.agency: INTRuST, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - Traumatic Brain Injury Clinical Consortium

collaborator.agency: U.S. Army Medical Research and Materiel Command

clinical_study.source: INTRuST, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - Traumatic Brain Injury Clinical Consortium

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study designed to determine whether veterans with PTSD have a higher risk of heart disease than those without PTSD. Cardiovascular risk will be assessed by interview and review of medical records, carotid artery ultrasound, and blood tests measuring markers of inflammation. Study participation is approximately 6 months. The eligible study population is veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) and Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF), age 28 through 38 years.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The funding agency, DoD, determined that the study could not meet its enrollment numbers by the end of the grant

primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the number of participants per month recruited from medical providers (with/without PTSD) vs. response to recruitment fliers (with/without PTSD) in the first 12 months of the study. Selection bias to be determined by looking at differences in age and co-morbid illnesses.

primary_outcome.measure: Completion of structured diagnostic interview within 2hrs.
primary_outcome.description: Completion of Clinician Assessed PTSD Scale (CAPS), Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test-Consumption (AUDIT-C), Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9), Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI), INTRuST Uniformed Data Set, and Family History of heart disease, within 2hrs.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability to schedule Carotid Intima-Media Thickness (CIMT) ultrasound in the Vascular Lab at VA San Diego Healthcare Systems, within 4 months of enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Determining whether the Vascular Lab has the capacity for a larger clinical study will be informative in planning larger prospective studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Time from CIMT completion to completion of clinical read.
primary_outcome.description: Rate of clinical read will help in determining adequate staffing requirements for a larger study.

secondary_outcome.description: CIMT thickness will be measured by carotid ultrasound
Serum C-reactive protein and interleukin-6 will be measured

arm_group.arm_group_label: Veterans with a history of PTSD
Veterans without a history of PTSD

biospec_descr.textblock:
For the assessment of CVD risk, high-sensitivity CRP (hs-CRP) measurements will be used. Standard assays detect 1,000 fold increases in CRP in response to infection or inflammation; these high levels cannot be used to stratify with respect to CVD risk. Hs-CRP, however, measurement can detect CRP levels as low as 0.5 mg/L. Though mainly used for research purposes, high-sensitivity IL-6 assays are also able to discriminate IL-6 levels within the normal range for CVD risk stratification. Both CRP and IL-6 levels will be analyzed as continuous quantitative traits.
Though no DNA analysis is planned for this study, subjects are asked if they are willing to have their samples banked for future research.

study_pop.textblock: OIF and OEF veterans within the VASDHS, who are between 28 and 38 years of age inclusively

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- OEF/OIF veterans at the VASDHS
- Between 28 and 38 years of age
- Willing to complete structured diagnostic interview for PTSD, CIMT ultrasound and blood test
- Willing to have a review of their medical records
- Able to give informed consent
- Have a negative urine pregnancy test, if a woman of child-bearing age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Do not meet inclusion criteria
- History of schizophrenia, other neurocognitive illness (including severe TBI by INTRuST criteria)) or active alcohol and/or drug abuse determined by chart review, interview or AUDIT-C score
- Inability to complete study tests within 18 months of study start
- Pregnancy
